intro: Stellularia monosperma, commonly known as the one-seeded starwort, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes plants known for their diverse morphological features. The plant is characterized by its star-shaped inflorescence, which gives it its common name. Its leaves are typically lanceolate and arranged in a basal rosette, while its flowers are small and clustered. Stellularia monosperma is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects.
